original: de na re re zhing yang re re dag la de bzhin gshegs pa dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'chad pa kho bo'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs kyi khyod kyi la ni ma yin no zhes de skad ces smra'o //
analyzed: de na re re zhing yang re re dag la de bzhin gshegs pa dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'chad pa kho bo'i seng ge'i khri la bzhugs kyi khyod kyi la ni ma yin no zhes de skad ces smra'o //
translated: Each of them says, The Tathagata is sitting on my lion throne and expounding the Heroic Stride Samadhi, not on yours.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gdul ba'i dbang dang / dpa' @412a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gdul ba'i dbang dang / dpa' @412a *//
translated: Then the World-Honored One, in order to discipline Indra, Brahma, the world guardians, and the other gods, and to cause them to enter the Dharma,

original: bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'ang brtsam pa tsam bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po yongs su bsdu ba'ang bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe ci nas kyang brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad dang / lha'i bu de dag gis seng ge'i khri bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag la sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bzhugs par mthong ba de lta bu'i ltas bstan to //
analyzed: bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'ang brtsam pa tsam bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po yongs su bsdu ba'ang bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe ci nas kyang brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad dang / lha'i bu de dag gis seng ge'i khri bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag la sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bzhugs par mthong ba de lta bu'i ltas bstan to //
translated: In order to demonstrate the beginning of this samādhi of the intermediate state, and in order to demonstrate the complete inclusion of the Mahāyāna, at that time the Tathāgata displayed a sign such that Śakra, Brahmā, the world protectors, and the gods all saw eighty-four hundred thousand quintillion lion thrones and eighty-four hundred thousand quintillion buddhas seated upon them.

original: de na 'khor de dag thams cad ngo mtshar du gyur nas bdag bdag gi stan de dag las langs te /
analyzed: de na 'khor de dag thams cad ngo mtshar du gyur nas bdag bdag gi stan de dag las langs te /

original: thams cad kyis thal mo sbyar nas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag btsal te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis thal mo sbyar nas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag btsal te /
translated: All of them joined their palms together, bowed to the Tathāgata,

original: tshig 'di skad ces legs so //
analyzed: tshig 'di skad ces legs so //
translated: and exclaimed, “Excellent!

original: legs so // 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas lha'i bu 'di dag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa ni ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: legs so // 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas lha'i bu 'di dag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa ni ngo mtshar te /
translated: It is wonderful that the Tathāgata has fulfilled the wishes of these devas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes smras so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes smras so //
translated: The domain of the buddha bhagavāns is inconceivable.”

original: de ltar lha'i bu ji snyed kyis sangs rgyas kyi seng ge'i khri bshams pa de dag thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i cho 'phrul 'di lta bu 'di mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i bu ji snyed kyis sangs rgyas kyi seng ge'i khri bshams pa de dag thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i cho 'phrul 'di lta bu 'di mthong nas /
translated: All those devas who had arranged the lion throne of the Buddha saw this kind of miracle of the Tathāgata’s manifestation.

original: thams cad kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas tshig 'di skad ces /
analyzed: thams cad kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas tshig 'di skad ces /
translated: All of them developed the aspiration for complete enlightenment and said these words:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān!

original: bdag cag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bgyi @412b pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bgyi ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad par bgyi ba'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bdag cag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bgyi @412b pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bgyi ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad par bgyi ba'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: We have aroused the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in order to make offerings to the Tathāgata, to pacify the suffering of all beings, to uphold the true Dharma, and to make the way of the Buddha uninterrupted.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar da ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar da ltar na /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽just as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha has manifested in the present,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa de bzhin du bdag cag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi yul la gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa de bzhin du bdag cag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi yul la gnas te /
translated: in the same way, in the future we will dwell in the domain of the Buddha

original: rnam par 'phrul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and manifest.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bu de dag la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /🔽legs so // legs so //🔽lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bu de dag la legs so zhes bya ba byin te / legs so // legs so // lha'i bu dag /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to those devas, “Excellent, excellent!🔽Excellent, sons of gods!

original: de de bzhin no //🔽lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: de de bzhin no // lha'i bu dag /
translated: Sons of gods, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: Sons of gods, it is just as you have said.

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i dam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i dam pa yin no //
translated: The bodhicitta that is generated for the sake of pacifying the suffering of all sentient beings, for the sake of upholding the sublime Dharma, and for the sake of ensuring the continuity of the way of the buddhas—that is the supreme offering to the Thus-Gone One.

original: de nas tshangs pa'i 'khor de'i nang nas tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i 'khor de'i nang nas tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, from within that assembly of Brahmās, a Brahmā named Abiding in Equality said to the Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag pa gang bdag gi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag pa gang bdag gi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa lags sam /

original: gang gzhan gyi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa @413a *//
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa @413a *//
translated: Or is he seated on someone else’s lion throne?”

original: lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the Brahmā Abiding in Equality,🔽“Brahmā, the Thus-Gone One is not seated on your lion throne, nor is he seated on someone else’s lion throne.

original: tshangs pa / chos thams cad ni bdag po med pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bur byung ba /🔽rnam par sgrub pas nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa med pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa / chos thams cad ni bdag po med pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bur byung ba / rnam par sgrub pas nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa med pa /
translated: “Brahmā, all phenomena are like illusions, because they are without an owner.

original: yongs su rtog pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa las byung ba ste /
translated: They are characterized by the absence of action, because they are established through conceptualization.

original: de dag ni ji lta ji ltar 'dod pa de lta de ltar rnam par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de dag ni ji lta ji ltar 'dod pa de lta de ltar rnam par sgrub bo //

analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: “Brahmā, all these tathāgatas are not real.

analyzed: tshangs pa / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad yang dag pa ma yin zhe na /

original: 'di dag ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not true.

analyzed: 'di dag ni mi bden bas na de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no // byung ba ma yin /
translated: They are not real because they are not true.🔽They are not arisen.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang ma yin pas na /
translated: They will not arise.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not real.

original: de dag ni 'byung ba chen pos ma bsdus pas na /
analyzed: de dag ni 'byung ba chen pos ma bsdus pas na /
translated: They are not included in the great elements.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not real.

original: 'di dag ni phung pos ma bsdus /🔽khams kyis ma bsdus /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phung pos ma bsdus / khams kyis ma bsdus /
translated: They are not included in the aggregates,🔽not included in the elements,

original: skye mched kyis ma bsdus pas na /
analyzed: skye mched kyis ma bsdus pas na /
translated: and not included in the sense bases.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not real.

original: 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin /🔽skyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin / skyes pa ma yin /
translated: They are not real,🔽not arisen,

original: byung ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: byung ba ma yin pas na /
translated: and not come into being.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not real.

original: 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not real,

original: @413b thog ma ji lta bar tha mtshar yang de bzhin /
analyzed: @413b thog ma ji lta bar tha mtshar yang de bzhin /
translated: just as the beginning is, so is the end,

analyzed: bar du'ang de bzhin pas na de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: and so is the middle. Therefore, they are not real.

original: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad ni mnyam pa ste khyad par med do //
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad ni mnyam pa ste khyad par med do //
translated: Brahmā, all these tathāgatas are the same, without distinction.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad dun de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad mnyam ste khyad par ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad dun de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad mnyam ste khyad par ma mchis pa lags /
translated: why are all these tathāgatas the same, without distinction?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
translated: “Brahmā, these tathāgatas are the same in terms of the suchness of form.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pas na de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
translated: They are the same in terms of the suchness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness. Therefore, they are the same.

original: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad ni thog ma'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag thams cad ni thog ma'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
translated: “Brahmā, all these tathāgatas are the same in terms of the suchness of the limit of the past.

original: tha ma'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
analyzed: tha ma'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam mo //
translated: They are the same in terms of the suchness of the present.

original: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni sgyu ma'i chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni sgyu ma'i chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
translated: “Brahmā, these tathāgatas are the same in terms of the suchness of illusory phenomena.

original: mig yor gyi chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pas na /
analyzed: mig yor gyi chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pas na /
translated: They are the same in terms of the suchness of reflected phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
translated: Therefore, they are the same.

original: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
translated: “Brahmā, these tathāgatas are the same in terms of the suchness of the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam /
translated: They are the same in terms of the suchness of the present.

original: ma chags pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pas na de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam pa zhes @414a *//
analyzed: ma chags pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pas na de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam pa zhes @414a *//
translated: Since they are equal by the suchness of non-attachment, therefore they are called ‘equal’.

original: bya'o // chos thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam /
analyzed: bya'o // chos thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam /
translated: All phenomena are equal to this, and they are also equal to that.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam /
translated: All sentient beings are equal to this, and they are also equal to that.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam /
translated: All buddhas are equal to this, and they are also equal to that.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad gang dang mnyam pa 'di dag kyang de dang mnyam pas na /

analyzed: tshangs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Brahmā, these tathāgatas do not transcend equality,

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
translated: therefore they are equal.

original: tshangs pa / de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni mnyam pa nyid las ma 'das te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag ni mnyam pa nyid las ma 'das te /
translated: Brahmā, therefore these tathāgatas do not transcend equality,

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni mnyam mo //
translated: therefore they are equal.

original: tshangs pa / de lta bas na de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de lta bas na de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Brahmā, that is why the Tathāgata has fully awakened to the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is said to abide in the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Brahmā, abiding in sameness, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la /
translated: the Tathāgata has fully awakened to the sameness of all phenomena,

original: gzugs kyi sku yongs su grub pa'ang sems can rnams la ston pa ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku yongs su grub pa'ang sems can rnams la ston pa ngo mtshar to //
translated: and yet he also displays the accomplishment of the form body to sentient beings. This is amazing!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said:

original: tshangs pa / de ni sngon dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin sbyangs @414b pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / de ni sngon dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin sbyangs @414b pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: “Brahmā, that is due to the distinctive training in the heroic progress samādhi.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, having thus fully awakened to the equality of all phenomena,

original: gzugs kyi sku yongs su grub pa'ang sems can rnams la ston to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku yongs su grub pa'ang sems can rnams la ston to //
translated: also reveals the accomplishment of the form body to sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this teaching on seeing the Tathāgata was explained,

analyzed: tshangs pa mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas chos la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob bo //
translated: Brahmā Abiding in Equality attained acceptance in accordance with the Dharma.

original: lha'i bu khris kyang chos la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: lha'i bu khris kyang chos la rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Ten thousand sons of gods also attained acceptance in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de 'dra ba'i rdzu 'phrul bsdus nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de 'dra ba'i rdzu 'phrul bsdus nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew that kind of miraculous power,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag thams cad mi snang bar byas pa dang / 'khor de dag thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pu mthong ngo //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' blo gros brtan pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Stable Intellect:

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /

translated: It is to have all absorptions become one. It is to observe with a knowledge that goes everywhere. It is to have unobstructed knowledge of remembering past lives. It is to see with the unobstructed divine eye.

original: zag pa zad par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir dus gcig tu 'thob pa shes pa dang / gzugs dang // gzugs med pa'i mnyam @415b pa nyid la 'jug pa shes pa dang / gzugs thams cad ston cing rnam par 'phrul pas rnam par rtse ba dang /

translated: It is to know the simultaneous attainment of the knowledge that exhausts the defilements and the knowledge that abandons them. It is to know the sameness of the form and formless realms. It is to play with the display of all forms.

original: sgra skad thams cad brag ca'i sgra dang mnyam pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa dang / gzungs la 'jug pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad legs par bshad pas tshim par byed pa dang / so so ci rigs par chos 'chad pa dang /

translated: It is to know that all sounds are like echoes. It is to have pure melodious speech. It is to know how to engage with dhāraṇī. It is to satisfy all beings with good explanations. It is to teach the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for each being.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa la rnam par lta ba dang / dbang po 'gyur ba shes pa dang / chos 'chad pa don med pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'jug pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad rab tu gzung ba dang /

translated: It is to know what is timely and untimely. It is to know the transformation of the faculties. It is to know how to teach the Dharma without it being meaningless. It is to know how to engage with the limit of reality. It is to know how to guide and defeat all beings.

original: tshar gcad pa la mkhas pa shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang / spyod lam ma brtags pa dang; rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa dang /

translated: It is to know how to be skilled in the perfections. It is to be beyond all examination, thought, reflection, and imagination.

translated: the skill in teaching the way out of all vehicles,🔽the ability to not fall away from the Mahāyāna,🔽the ability to uphold the lineage of the Three Jewels,🔽the ability to don the armor that is firm and indefatigable until the end of time,

original: chen po las mi nyams pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs 'dzin pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal por go cha sra zhing yongs su mi skyo ba dang / skye ba'i gnas thams cad du ci rigs par byed pa ston pa dang /

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa la mkhas pa dang / nyan thos dang; rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyis gting dpag dka' ba dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad mngon par sgrub pa bstan pa shes pa dang /

translated: “It is to be skilled in the knowledge of ripening all beings. It is to be difficult to fathom for the wisdom of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas. It is to know how to teach the accomplishment of all aspects of melodious speech.

original: chos thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i gnas shes pa dang / bskal pa gcig tu bskal pa grangs med pa 'jug pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa la bskal pa gcig 'jug pa dang / zhing thams cad du zhing gcig yang dag par 'du zhing 'jug pa dang /

translated: “It is to know the state that is superior to all phenomena. It is to enter countless eons in a single eon and to enter a single eon in countless eons. It is to gather and enter a single realm in all realms.

original: zhing gcig la zhing thams cad ston pa shes pa dang / skra'i khyon gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa 'jug pa shes pa dang / sems can gcig gi lus la sems can thams cad kyi lus yang dag par 'du zhing 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: zhing gcig la zhing thams cad ston pa shes pa dang / skra'i khyon gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa 'jug pa shes pa dang / sems can gcig gi lus la sems can thams cad kyi lus yang dag par 'du zhing 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to display all realms in a single realm. It is to know how to engage in the perception of the inconceivably vast buddha realms in a single hair. It is to know how to gather and engage in the bodies of all beings in the body of a single being.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / rang gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par 'gengs @416b pa dang / rang gi lus lus thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / rang gi lus la sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par 'gengs @416b pa dang / rang gi lus lus thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to realize that all buddha realms are the same as space. It is to pervade with one’s body all the infinite buddha realms. It is to engage with all bodies through one’s own body.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rtogs pa la mkhas pa dang / thabs thams cad la mkhas pa dang / thabs thams cad la mkhas pa'i bya ba shes pa dang / sgra skad gcig byung bas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du grags pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rtogs pa la mkhas pa dang / thabs thams cad la mkhas pa dang / thabs thams cad la mkhas pa'i bya ba shes pa dang / sgra skad gcig byung bas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du grags pa dang /
translated: It is to be skilled in realizing that all phenomena are without characteristics. It is to be skilled in all methods. It is to know how to engage in all skillful activities. It is for the sound of a single voice to be heard throughout the entire realm of phenomena.

original: tshig gcig la brtsams nas bskal pa grangs med par 'chad pa dang / chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su rtogs pa dang / chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba thams cad bstan pa la mkhas pa shes pa dang / 'gre ba dang / 'gre pa ma yin pa la mkhas pa shes pas rnam par dpyod pa dang /
analyzed: tshig gcig la brtsams nas bskal pa grangs med par 'chad pa dang / chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su rtogs pa dang / chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba thams cad bstan pa la mkhas pa shes pa dang / 'gre ba dang / 'gre pa ma yin pa la mkhas pa shes pas rnam par dpyod pa dang /
translated: It is to explain a single word for countless eons. It is to realize that all phenomena are the Dharma of the Buddha. It is to know the skill in teaching all the divisions of the words of the Dharma. It is to analyze with the knowledge of the skill in knowing what is to be applied and what is not to be applied.

original: zung gi rim pa dang / snrel zhi'i rgyud bstan pa shes pa dang / bdud kyi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba shes pa dang / thabs chen po la mkhas pas shes rab dang / ye shes kyi 'od zer gtong ba dang /
analyzed: zung gi rim pa dang / snrel zhi'i rgyud bstan pa shes pa dang / bdud kyi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba shes pa dang / thabs chen po la mkhas pas shes rab dang / ye shes kyi 'od zer gtong ba dang /
translated: It is to know the teaching of the sequence of pairs and the intertwined continuum. It is to know the transcendence of all the paths of Māra. It is to emit the light rays of insight and wisdom through the skill of great means.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang; mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du gyur cing thob pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can gyi khams thams cad tshim par byed pa dang /🔽chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyis kras par rnam par 'phrul pa ston pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams @417a *//
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang; mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du gyur cing thob pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can gyi khams thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyis kras par rnam par 'phrul pa ston pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams @417a *//
translated: It is to have wisdom precede all physical, verbal, and mental actions. It is to actualize and attain the supernormal knowledge that is not created. It is to satisfy all beings with the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽It is to display emanations throughout the entire realm of phenomena. It is to gather all beings through the four means of attraction.

original: thams cad du sems can gyi tha snyad thams cad rtogs pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i chos sgrub pa la the tshom med pa dang / skye ba thams cad la dbang thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yo byad la dbang thob pa dang /

translated: It is to understand all the conventions of beings in all world systems. It is to have no doubts about accomplishing illusory phenomena. It is to perfect the attainment of mastery over all births. It is to attain mastery over resources.

original: sems can thams cad bsam pa bzhin du tshim par byed pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la sbyin gnas su sems mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gsang ba thams cad thob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'ong zer gtong ba dang; thams cad mkhyan pa'i rgya mtsho dug can pa gting dpag dka' ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsam pa bzhin du tshim par byed pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la sbyin gnas su sems mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gsang ba thams cad thob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'ong zer gtong ba dang; thams cad mkhyan pa'i rgya mtsho dug can pa gting dpag dka' ba shes pa dang /
translated: satisfying all beings according to their wishes, having the same attitude toward those with and without moral discipline, attaining all the secrets of the bodhisattvas, sending out rays of light to all world systems, knowing the ocean of omniscience that is difficult to fathom,

original: sems dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang mnyam pa dang / tshig bstan pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa dang / ma bstan par rang gis bzod pa dang / ye shes thob pa dang /
analyzed: sems dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang mnyam pa dang / tshig bstan pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa dang / ma bstan par rang gis bzod pa dang / ye shes thob pa dang /
translated: being equal to the mind, water, fire, and wind, turning the wheel of Dharma in all the teachings of words, entering the stage of the tathagatas, attaining patience and wisdom without being taught,

original: rin po che lta bu'i sems bskyed bas kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dri mas mi gos pa dang / spu gcig gi khung bur chu'i phung po thams cad chud par byed la /
analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i sems bskyed bas kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dri mas mi gos pa dang / spu gcig gi khung bur chu'i phung po thams cad chud par byed la /
translated: the ability to cause all the water in the world to enter the hole of a single hair without harming any of the beings living in the water;🔽the knowledge of how to dedicate the accumulation of the immeasurable roots of virtue and merit;

original: chu na gnas pa'i sems can la'ang gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa'i bsod nams gsog pa'i snying po yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i bya ba shes pa dang / @417b sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chu na gnas pa'i sems can la'ang gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa'i bsod nams gsog pa'i snying po yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i bya ba shes pa dang / @417b sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa dang /
translated: the unobstructed knowledge of the conduct and magical abilities of all beings;🔽the attainment of the relief that comes from fully awakening to all the qualities of a buddha;

original: 'phrul pa la ye shes thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dbugs 'byin pa thob pa dang / rang gi lus kyi smon lam gyis sems can 'dzin pa'i spyod pa'i gnas rgyun ma bcad pa kun tu ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'phrul pa la ye shes thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dbugs 'byin pa thob pa dang / rang gi lus kyi smon lam gyis sems can 'dzin pa'i spyod pa'i gnas rgyun ma bcad pa kun tu ston pa dang /
translated: the ability to display the uninterrupted conduct of holding beings with the power of one’s own aspirations;

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rnam par lta ba mngon sum du gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba la 'jug pa dang / rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang /🔽longs spyod thams cad kun tu ston pa dang / sems zhi zhing rab tu zhil nye bar zhi ba dang / thos pa tshad med pa 'dzin pa rdzogs pa dang / thos pa thams cad kyi nan tan rgyun mi gcod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rnam par lta ba mngon sum du gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba la 'jug pa dang / rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang / longs spyod thams cad kun tu ston pa dang / sems zhi zhing rab tu zhil nye bar zhi ba dang / thos pa tshad med pa 'dzin pa rdzogs pa dang / thos pa thams cad kyi nan tan rgyun mi gcod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the domain of all buddhas. It is to directly perceive the wisdom of the thus-gone ones. It is to understand the secrets of the thus-gone ones. It is to perfect the retention of immeasurable teachings. It is to never cease the practice of all that has been heard. It is to engage in the various activities of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa snga dro gcig tu byin gyis rlob cing chos 'chad pa dang / spyod lam thams cad du lkug pa dang / grum po dang / rna ba mi gsang ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa snga dro gcig tu byin gyis rlob cing chos 'chad pa dang / spyod lam thams cad du lkug pa dang / grum po dang / rna ba mi gsang ba dang /

original: glen pa dang / 'on pa dang / long ba ston cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / lce'i dbang pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad khebs bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas 'byung ba ston pa dang /

translated: They ripen beings by displaying the forms of fools, the deaf, and the blind. With their tongues they cover all the buddha realms without exception. They display the appearance of buddhas in worlds where there are no buddhas.

original: lag na rdo rje 'bum rtag tu phyi bzhin du @418a *//

analyzed: 'brang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub rang byung gi ye shes la rnam par lta ba mngon sum du gyur pa dang / rtag par 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams la sreg pa'i bskal pa ston pa dang / tshe'i tshad bskal pa tshad med pa bye ba khrag khrig pa rgya stong du byin gyis rlob pa dang /

original: gzhan yang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs par yang shes la ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan gyi spyod pa rnam par 'byed pa'ang ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs par yang shes la ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan gyi spyod pa rnam par 'byed pa'ang ston to //
translated: Furthermore, the bodhisattva who abides in this heroic meditative absorption knows that all phenomena are naturally absorbed in meditative equipoise, and he also demonstrates the conduct of meditative absorption and meditative stability.

original: de sems can sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams ting nge 'dzin la gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de sems can sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams ting nge 'dzin la gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to lead those sentient beings whose minds are distracted to meditative absorption,

original: bdag bsam gtan la gnas par yang ston la chos kyi dbyings la rnam par g-yengs pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag bsam gtan la gnas par yang ston la chos kyi dbyings la rnam par g-yengs pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: he demonstrates abiding in meditative stability, yet he does not see any phenomena that are distracted from the basic space of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam par @426a *//
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam par @426a *//
translated: He is certain that all phenomena are equal to the basic space of phenomena,

original: yid la nges par sems shing gnas la de ting nge 'dzin dang / sems rtse gcig pa las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: yid la nges par sems shing gnas la de ting nge 'dzin dang / sems rtse gcig pa las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: and he abides in that certainty, yet he does not waver from meditative absorption and one-pointed focus.

original: mnyam par yang 'jog la 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'chag pa dang / nyal bar yang byed do //
analyzed: mnyam par yang 'jog la 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'chag pa dang / nyal bar yang byed do //
translated: He is also able to rest in equipoise, and he comes and goes, sits and stands, walks and lies down.

original: de spyod lam thams cad kyang ston la gcig tu snyoms par zhugs pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de spyod lam thams cad kyang ston la gcig tu snyoms par zhugs pa'ang yin no //
translated: He displays all forms of conduct, and yet he remains absorbed in meditative equipoise.

original: de smra bar yang snang la ting nge 'dzin gyi chos nyid de'ang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: de smra bar yang snang la ting nge 'dzin gyi chos nyid de'ang mi gtong ngo //
translated: He appears to be speaking, and yet he does not abandon the reality of meditative absorption.

original: blo gros brtan pa /🔽de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe na sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe na sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,🔽in this way, when bodhisattvas enter a town, city, market, country, region, or royal palace in order to benefit other sentient beings and other individuals,

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du 'gro zhing 'jug pa de'i tshe'ang mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du 'gro zhing 'jug pa de'i tshe'ang mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin no //
translated: at that time they are in meditative equipoise.

original: gang gi tshe na sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir zas za ba de'i tshe'ang mnyam par bzhag bzhin du zas za'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir zas za ba de'i tshe'ang mnyam par bzhag bzhin du zas za'o //
translated: When he eats food out of compassion for other sentient beings and other persons, he eats food while remaining in meditative equipoise.

original: de zas za bar yang snang la byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus gcig tu mkhregs pa /
analyzed: de zas za bar yang snang la byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus gcig tu mkhregs pa /
translated: Even though he appears to eat food, the body of that bodhisattva is solid,

original: sra ba / snying por gyur pa /
analyzed: sra ba / snying por gyur pa /
translated: hard, and substantial.

original: rdo rje lta bu /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu /
translated: It is like a vajra.

original: khong stong ma yin pa; mi phyed pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: khong stong ma yin pa; mi phyed pa'ang yin no //
translated: It is not hollow and is indivisible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i khong na long ka dang pho ba'ang med /🔽bshad pa dang gci ba'ang med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i khong na long ka dang pho ba'ang med / bshad pa dang gci ba'ang med /
translated: There is no stomach or intestines in that bodhisattva.🔽There is no feces or urine.

original: snabs dang mchil ma'ang med /
analyzed: snabs dang mchil ma'ang med /
translated: There is no mucus or saliva.

original: mi gtsang ba'ang med //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'ang med //
translated: There is no impurity.

original: @426b dri mi zhim pa'ang med do //
analyzed: @426b dri mi zhim pa'ang med do //
translated: There is no foul smell.

original: de za bar yang mi byed la mid par yang mi byed /
analyzed: de za bar yang mi byed la mid par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not eat or swallow.

original: za ba'ang med do //
analyzed: za ba'ang med do //
translated: There is no eating.

original: sems can la snying brtse ba'i phyir de za bar yang snang la de thams cad du kha na ma tho ba'ang med pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can la snying brtse ba'i phyir de za bar yang snang la de thams cad du kha na ma tho ba'ang med pa yin te /
translated: Out of compassion for sentient beings, he appears to eat, but he is completely free of any misdeed.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de ltar na dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'i spyad pa thams cad spyod par yang snang la gang du'ang spyod pa'ang med /🔽rab tu spyod par yang med /
analyzed: de ltar na dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'i spyad pa thams cad spyod par yang snang la gang du'ang spyod pa'ang med / rab tu spyod par yang med /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is established in this samādhi of the heroic stride appears to engage in all the conduct of childish ordinary beings, yet he does not engage in anything at all.🔽He does not engage in anything at all.

original: kun spyod pa'ang med de /
analyzed: kun spyod pa'ang med de /
translated: He does not engage in anything at all.

original: spyod pa thams cad las kyang log pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad las kyang log pa yin no //
translated: He is also turned away from all conduct.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i lam yongs su sbyong ba byed pa'i bye brag tu blta'o //
analyzed: de ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i lam yongs su sbyong ba byed pa'i bye brag tu blta'o //
translated: this is how you should understand the bodhisattva who is established in this samādhi of the heroic stride to be training on the path of definite emergence that is the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

analyzed: gzhan yang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la ngas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dgon pa na gnas par yang snang la de la dgon pa ji lta bar de la grong yang de bzhin no //
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva who is established in this samādhi of the heroic stride appears to dwell in the wilderness, and to him the wilderness is just like a town.

original: de gos dkar po gyon zhing khyim gyi gnas na gnas par yang snang la de la khyim ji lta bar rab tu byung ba'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de gos dkar po gyon zhing khyim gyi gnas na gnas par yang snang la de la khyim ji lta bar rab tu byung ba'ang de bzhin no //
translated: He appears to be wearing white clothes and living in a house, but he is also like a renunciant.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni khyim gyi chos kyis kyang mi gos la rab tu byung ba'i chos kyis kyang rlom sems med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni khyim gyi chos kyis kyang mi gos la rab tu byung ba'i chos kyis kyang rlom sems med do //
translated: the bodhisattva is not defiled by the qualities of a householder, and he does not become arrogant because of the qualities of a renunciant.

original: de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ya mtshan can thams cad kyi nang du @427a *//
analyzed: de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ya mtshan can thams cad kyi nang du @427a *//
translated: In order to ripen beings, he appears as a renunciant among all the extremists,

original: rab tu byung bar yang snang la de gang du'ang ya mtshan can gyi lta bar 'gyur ba'ang med /
analyzed: rab tu byung bar yang snang la de gang du'ang ya mtshan can gyi lta bar 'gyur ba'ang med /
translated: but he does not have any extremist views.

original: des dag par yid ches pa'ang med do //
analyzed: des dag par yid ches pa'ang med do //
translated: He does not have any faith in purity.

original: de ya mtshan can thams cad kyi kha dog dang / gzugs dang / rtags kyang ston la de la zhugs pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de ya mtshan can thams cad kyi kha dog dang / gzugs dang / rtags kyang ston la de la zhugs pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He displays the colors, forms, and signs of all the extremists, but he is not engaged in them.

original: de la gzhol ba'ang ma yin /🔽de la 'bab pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de la gzhol ba'ang ma yin / de la 'bab pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He is not devoted to them.🔽He does not descend into them.

original: de la bab pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bab pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He does not descend from them.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / mgron po phal po che'i lam la mtshon pa yongs su 'dren pa de ni lam yang ston la lam de nyid du'ang 'gro zhing /
analyzed: dper na / mgron po phal po che'i lam la mtshon pa yongs su 'dren pa de ni lam yang ston la lam de nyid du'ang 'gro zhing /
translated: It is like the example of the guide who leads a great multitude of travelers on the path, who shows the path and also goes along that very path.

original: slar yang log nas mgron po phal po che gzhan dag kyang sgrol lo //
analyzed: slar yang log nas mgron po phal po che gzhan dag kyang sgrol lo //
translated: And then, turning back, he rescues other great multitudes of travelers.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ji lta bu'i theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa dag la lam ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ji lta bu'i theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa dag la lam ston te /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva who is in this heroic stride absorption shows the path to infinite sentient beings who are on the path of the vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dag la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam ston /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dag la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam ston /
translated: To sentient beings who are on the path of the vehicle of the hearers, he shows the path of the vehicle of the hearers.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dag la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam ston /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dag la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam ston /
translated: To sentient beings who are on the path of the vehicle of the solitary realizers, he shows the path of the vehicle of the solitary realizers.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dag la ni theg pa chen po'i lam ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i lam la gnas pa'i sems can dag la ni theg pa chen po'i lam ston te /
translated: To sentient beings who are on the path of the vehicle of the buddhas, he shows the path of the Great Vehicle.

original: nges par 'byung ba de dag la so so ci rigs par lam bstan nas slar log ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba de dag la so so ci rigs par lam bstan nas slar log ste /
translated: Having taught the path to those who are to be liberated, he returns.

original: sems can gzhan dag kyang sgrol @427b par byed pas de'i phyir skyes bu dam pa de ni lam mtshon pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag kyang sgrol @427b par byed pas de'i phyir skyes bu dam pa de ni lam mtshon pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: And he liberates other beings as well. Therefore, that holy being is like a ferryman.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / gru legs par sbyar ba byas pa ni sems can tshad med pa bsgral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na / gru legs par sbyar ba byas pa ni sems can tshad med pa bsgral ba'i phyir /
translated: A well-constructed boat, in order to liberate countless beings,

analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram nas pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro zhing bsgral nas /
translated: goes from this shore to the other shore, and having liberated them,

analyzed: sems can gzhan bsgral ba'i phyir slar yang pha rol gyi 'gram nas tshu rol gyi 'gram du 'ong ngo; ;blo gros brtan pa /
translated: returns from the other shore to this shore in order to liberate other beings.🔽Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor ba'i rgyun la gnas pa'i chu bo bzhis ded pa'i sems can dag mthong nas de dag 'khor ba'i rgyun las bsgral ba'i phyir sems can de dag ji ltar mos
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor ba'i rgyun la gnas pa'i chu bo bzhis ded pa'i sems can dag mthong nas de dag 'khor ba'i rgyun las bsgral ba'i phyir sems can de dag ji ltar mos
translated: Likewise, when bodhisattvas who are abiding in this heroic stride concentration see sentient beings being carried away by the four rivers that flow through the stream of samsara, in order to liberate them from the stream of samsara, they teach them the Dharma in accordance with their aspirations.

original: pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' ba ston par byed de /
analyzed: pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' ba ston par byed de /
translated: Likewise, when bodhisattvas who are abiding in this heroic stride concentration see sentient beings who are being carried away by the four rivers of the continuity of saṃsāra, in order to liberate them from the continuity of saṃsāra, they teach nirvāṇa in accordance with the aspirations🔽of those sentient beings.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gal te nyan thos kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i sems can dag mthong na /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gal te nyan thos kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i sems can dag mthong na /
translated: If the bodhisattvas who are abiding in this heroic stride concentration see sentient beings who are to be trained by the vehicle of the hearers,

original: de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir de'ang de dag dang lhan cig tu yongs su mya ngan las kyang 'da' la /
analyzed: de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir de'ang de dag dang lhan cig tu yongs su mya ngan las kyang 'da' la /
translated: in order to bring them to complete nirvāṇa, they will also enter complete nirvāṇa together with them.

original: de dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi stobs bskyed pas slar skye bar yang ston to //
analyzed: de dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi stobs bskyed pas slar skye bar yang ston to //
translated: However, through the power of this heroic stride concentration, they will again manifest birth.

original: de gal te rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i sems can dag mthong na /
analyzed: de gal te rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i sems can dag mthong na /
translated: If he sees beings who are to be guided by the vehicle of the solitary buddhas,

original: de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir de'ang de dag dang lhan cig tu yongs su mya ngan las kyang 'da' la /🔽de dpa' @428a *//
analyzed: de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir de'ang de dag dang lhan cig tu yongs su mya ngan las kyang 'da' la / de dpa' @428a *//
translated: he will pass into parinirvāṇa together with them in order to help them attain parinirvāṇa.

original: bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi stobs bskyed pas slar yang skye bar ston to //
analyzed: bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid kyi stobs bskyed pas slar yang skye bar ston to //
translated: But through the power of this samādhi, the heroic one will manifest birth again.

original: de 'khor ba las mya ngan las 'das par yang 'gro la sems can gzhan bsgral ba'i phyir slar yang 'khor ba na'ang snang ste /
analyzed: de 'khor ba las mya ngan las 'das par yang 'gro la sems can gzhan bsgral ba'i phyir slar yang 'khor ba na'ang snang ste /
translated: He will go from saṃsāra to nirvāṇa, and in order to liberate other beings he will again appear in saṃsāra.🔽Those beings are like ferrymen.

original: skyes bu de dag ni mnyan pa lta bu zhes bya'o //🔽blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu de dag ni mnyan pa lta bu zhes bya'o // blo gros brtan pa /
translated: “Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan ni skye bo phal po che tshogs pa'i mdun du bdag shi bar ston te / bdag tshig pa'am /
translated: For example, a magician in front of a large gathering of people may show himself dying,🔽or he may show himself burned,🔽or he may show himself eaten, or he may show himself caught in a snare,🔽or he may show himself bound,

original: zos pa'am / rnyis pa'am /
analyzed: zos pa'am / rnyis pa'am /
translated: or he may show himself beaten,🔽or he may show himself with his body cut apart.

analyzed: skams pa'am / rnam par 'thor pa bstan nas des sems can de dag las nor blangs te /
translated: He then shows them a withered or scattered [corpse], and they take the jewel from that being.

original: slar 'dug par byed do //
analyzed: slar 'dug par byed do //
translated: Then he makes them sit down again.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'ang ston la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'ang ston la /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva who is in the heroic stride meditative absorption shows birth, aging, sickness, and death in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: de skye ba'ang med /
analyzed: de skye ba'ang med /
translated: But he has no birth,

original: rga ba'ang med /
analyzed: rga ba'ang med /
translated: no aging,

original: na ba'ang med /
analyzed: na ba'ang med /
translated: no sickness,

original: 'chi ba'ang med do //
analyzed: 'chi ba'ang med do //
translated: and no death.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de'ang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byed pa'i bye brag tu blta'o //
analyzed: de'ang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byed pa'i bye brag tu blta'o //
translated: that should be seen as a particular kind of purification of the meditative absorption of the bodhisattva who is in the heroic stride meditative absorption.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: gzhan yang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: further, the bodhisattva who is in the heroic stride meditative absorption is endowed with wisdom.

analyzed: shes rab rno bas de sems can @428b gyi rang bzhin yang mi dmigs la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sems can sems can zhes tha snyad kyang 'dogs so //

analyzed: srog dang / gang zag gi rang bzhin yang mi dmigs la srog dang / gang zag du tha snyad gdags pa'ang tha snyad du 'dogs so //
