original: las dang / rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yang mi dmigs la las dang / rnam par smin pa'ang ston to //
analyzed: las dang / rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yang mi dmigs la las dang / rnam par smin pa'ang ston to //
translated: They do not apprehend the nature of karma and ripening, but they also teach karma and ripening.

original: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yang mi dmigs la 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i yongs su shes pa'ang ston to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yang mi dmigs la 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i yongs su shes pa'ang ston to //
translated: They do not apprehend the nature of the afflictions of saṃsāra, but they also teach the thorough knowledge of the afflictions of saṃsāra.

original: mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro ba'ang mi gtong la mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro ba'ang mi gtong la mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyang ston to //
translated: They do not abandon going to nirvāṇa, but they also teach the Dharma in order to go to nirvāṇa.

original: chos gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnam par gzhag pa'ang ston to //
analyzed: chos gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnam par gzhag pa'ang ston to //
translated: They do not apprehend the designation of phenomena, but they also teach the presentation of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: de shes rab thogs pa med pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas 'dod pa'i khams la'ang mi chags la de na'ang snang ngo //
analyzed: de shes rab thogs pa med pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas 'dod pa'i khams la'ang mi chags la de na'ang snang ngo //
translated: Because of the perfection of the highest unobstructed wisdom, he is not attached to the desire realm, but he appears there.

original: gzugs kyi khams la'ang mi chags la de na'ang snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la'ang mi chags la de na'ang snang ngo //
translated: He is not attached to the form realm, but he appears there.

original: de gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs par yang snang la 'dod pa'i khams su'ang skye'o //
analyzed: de gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs par yang snang la 'dod pa'i khams su'ang skye'o //
translated: He appears to enter the meditative absorptions of the form realm, but he is born in the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs par yang snang la gzugs kyi khams su'ang skye'o //🔽de ni 'dod pa'i khams na spyod par yang snang la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la'ang snyoms @429a *//
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs par yang snang la gzugs kyi khams su'ang skye'o // de ni 'dod pa'i khams na spyod par yang snang la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la'ang snyoms @429a *//
translated: He appears to enter the meditative absorptions of the formless realm, but he is born in the form realm.

original: par 'jug cing 'dod pa'i khams su'ang skye'o //
analyzed: par 'jug cing 'dod pa'i khams su'ang skye'o //
translated: He appears to be active in the desire realm, but he enters the meditative absorption of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and is born in the desire realm.

original: de bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag rnams kyang shes shing mnyam par 'jog pa dang ldang bar yang byed la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir du gang dang gang du 'dong ba de dang der skye bar yang byed do //
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag rnams kyang shes shing mnyam par 'jog pa dang ldang bar yang byed la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir du gang dang gang du 'dong ba de dang der skye bar yang byed do //
translated: They know the meditative concentrations and the branches of the meditative concentrations, and they enter into and rise up from them. And in order to ripen beings, they are born wherever they go.

original: de thabs dang / shes rab kyi yongs su bzung bas spyod pa thams cad las ldog pa la'ang gnas la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang spyod do //
analyzed: de thabs dang / shes rab kyi yongs su bzung bas spyod pa thams cad las ldog pa la'ang gnas la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang spyod do //
translated: They are sustained by skillful means and wisdom, and so they abide in the cessation of all practices, and yet they engage in practices in order to ripen beings.

original: chos gang la'ang nye bar mi spyod la spyod pa thams cad las kyang ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang nye bar mi spyod la spyod pa thams cad las kyang ma log pa yin no //
translated: They do not engage with any phenomena, and yet they do not turn away from any practices.

original: de ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag dang yang bral ba yin la len pa dang / gtong bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: de ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag dang yang bral ba yin la len pa dang / gtong bar yang snang ngo //
translated: They are free from the grasping at “I” and “mine,” and yet they appear to take and to give.

original: de shes rab dang / ye shes dang ldan pas ye shes kyis byas pa'i chos thams cad byed kyi /
analyzed: de shes rab dang / ye shes dang ldan pas ye shes kyis byas pa'i chos thams cad byed kyi /
translated: They are endowed with wisdom and knowledge, and so they engage with all phenomena that are created by knowledge.

original: nga rgyal gyis byed pa'ang ma yin la las dang / rnam par smin par brjod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis byed pa'ang ma yin la las dang / rnam par smin par brjod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He does not act out of pride, nor does he speak of karma and its ripening.🔽In order to ripen beings, he may appear as a mute, a fool, an idiot, or a deaf person, yet he may also speak with the voice of Brahmā.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir; de lug ltar lkug pa dang / blun pa dang / glen pa dang / 'on par yang ston la de tshangs pa'i sgra dang / skad dang / dbyangs kyi sgra 'byin pa dang ldan pa'ang yin no; ;de bzo thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ci zhig bshad ces mi rtog /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir; de lug ltar lkug pa dang / blun pa dang / glen pa dang / 'on par yang ston la de tshangs pa'i sgra dang / skad dang / dbyangs kyi sgra 'byin pa dang ldan pa'ang yin no; ;de bzo thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ci zhig bshad ces mi rtog /
translated: He has perfected all crafts and, with the perfection of insight, does not think, “What should I say?”

original: ci zhig smra zhes mi sems /
analyzed: ci zhig smra zhes mi sems /
translated: He does not think, “What should I speak?”

original: ji ltar bstan par bya zhes @429b 'tshal bar yang mi byed la //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan par bya zhes @429b 'tshal bar yang mi byed la //
translated: He does not wonder, “How should I teach?”

original: 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang de dag tu lhun gyis grub cing /
analyzed: 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang de dag tu lhun gyis grub cing /
translated: Wherever he goes in the retinue, he does so spontaneously.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'khor thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa'i phyir chos la spobs par byed de /🔽de'i ye shes bri ba'am /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'khor thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa'i phyir chos la spobs par byed de / de'i ye shes bri ba'am /
translated: Through the power of the samādhi of the heroic stride, he has the eloquence of Dharma in order to know the faculties of the entire retinue, whether they are supreme or not.🔽His wisdom will not be diminished

original: gang bar yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang bar yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: or filled up.

original: 'khor thams cad kyang legs par bshad pas tshim par byed do //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyang legs par bshad pas tshim par byed do //
translated: He will satisfy the entire retinue with good explanations.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: dper na / bud med dam /
analyzed: dper na / bud med dam /
translated: For example, a woman,

original: skyes pa'am / khye'u'am /🔽bu mos snod chung du'ang rung /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / khye'u'am / bu mos snod chung du'ang rung /
translated: a man, a boy,🔽or a girl,

original: chen po'ang rung ste /
analyzed: chen po'ang rung ste /
translated: whether with a small or a large vessel,🔽will take it

original: ji tsam pa de khyer nas /🔽chu mig gam /🔽mtshe'u'am / rdzing ngam /
analyzed: ji tsam pa de khyer nas / chu mig gam / mtshe'u'am / rdzing ngam /
translated: to a spring,🔽a lake, a pond,

original: lteng ka'am / 'bab chu'am /
analyzed: lteng ka'am / 'bab chu'am /
translated: a pool, a waterfall,

original: rgya mtsho chen por stong ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por stong ste /
translated: or the great ocean, and fill it up.

original: snod de dag thams cad yongs su bkang nas song yang chu mig gam; mtshe'u'am /
analyzed: snod de dag thams cad yongs su bkang nas song yang chu mig gam; mtshe'u'am /
translated: Even though they all go to the spring, the lake,

original: rdzing ngam / lteng ka'am /
analyzed: rdzing ngam / lteng ka'am /
translated: the pond, the pool,

original: 'bab chu'am / rgya mtsho chen po de'ang cung zad kyang bri ba'ang med la sems can de dag kyang tshim par byed do //
analyzed: 'bab chu'am / rgya mtsho chen po de'ang cung zad kyang bri ba'ang med la sems can de dag kyang tshim par byed do //
translated: The river or the great ocean does not diminish in the least, and it satisfies those beings.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro'ang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro'ang rung ste /
translated: in the same way, when a bodhisattva who is in this heroic stride samādhi goes to any assembly,

original: gal te rgyal rigs kyi 'khor ram /
analyzed: gal te rgyal rigs kyi 'khor ram /
translated: whether it is an assembly of kṣatriyas,

original: gal te bram ze'i 'khor ram /🔽gal te khyim bdag gi 'khor ram /
analyzed: gal te bram ze'i 'khor ram / gal te khyim bdag gi 'khor ram /
translated: an assembly of brahmins,🔽an assembly of householders,

original: gal te dge sbyong gi 'khor ram /🔽gal te brgya byin gyi 'khor ram /
analyzed: gal te dge sbyong gi 'khor ram / gal te brgya byin gyi 'khor ram /
translated: an assembly of ascetics,🔽an assembly of Śakras,

original: gal te tshangs pa'i 'khor du 'gro na'ang /
analyzed: gal te tshangs pa'i 'khor du 'gro na'ang /
translated: or an assembly of Brahmās,

original: @430a *// de dag thams cad la lhun gyis grub cing legs par bshad pas tshim par byed de /
analyzed: @430a *// de dag thams cad la lhun gyis grub cing legs par bshad pas tshim par byed de /
translated: he will satisfy them all with his spontaneous and eloquent explanations.

original: ji lta bur rigs pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'chad pa 'byung yang /
analyzed: ji lta bur rigs pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos 'chad pa 'byung yang /
translated: He will teach the Dharma in a way that is appropriate to them, in accordance with their faculties and their inclinations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab dang / ye shes dang / spobs pa dang / ston pa yongs su bri ba'ang med la 'khor thams cad kyang legs par bshad pas tshim par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i shes rab dang / ye shes dang / spobs pa dang / ston pa yongs su bri ba'ang med la 'khor thams cad kyang legs par bshad pas tshim par byed do //
translated: The wisdom, gnosis, eloquence, and teaching of that bodhisattva are inexhaustible, and the entire retinue is satisfied by the excellent explanations.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mthong ma thag tu'ang sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do; ;thos pa dang / spyod lam dang / bshad pa dang / mi smra bar 'dug pas kyang sems can dag 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mthong ma thag tu'ang sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do; ;thos pa dang / spyod lam dang / bshad pa dang / mi smra bar 'dug pas kyang sems can dag 'dul bar byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva who abides in this heroic progress samādhi tames beings as soon as he is seen, and he also tames beings through hearing, conduct, explanation, and remaining silent.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / sman gyi rgyal po chen po blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ma thag tu sems can dag gi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / sman gyi rgyal po chen po blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ma thag tu sems can dag gi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: the great king of medicines called ‘beautiful to behold’ immediately cures the illnesses of beings.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang mthong ma thag tu sems can de dag gi nad 'di lta ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang mthong ma thag tu sems can de dag gi nad 'di lta ste //
translated: In the same way, as soon as those sentient beings see the bodhisattva who is in this heroic stride absorption, their illnesses are cured, namely,🔽their illnesses of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nad rnams sel bar byed do; ;blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nad rnams sel bar byed do; ;blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / sman gyi rgyal po chen po 'bral ba zhes bya ba des bskus pa'i rnga chen po g-yul gyi ngogs su brdungs na /
analyzed: dper na / sman gyi rgyal po chen po 'bral ba zhes bya ba des bskus pa'i rnga chen po g-yul gyi ngogs su brdungs na /
translated: a great king of medicines called “separation” is applied to a great drum, which is beaten on the battlefield.

original: rnga'i sgra de thos ma @430b thag tu sems can rnams zug rdu rnams ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnga'i sgra de thos ma @430b thag tu sems can rnams zug rdu rnams ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: As soon as sentient beings hear the sound of that drum, their wounds are healed,

original: dug thams cad kyang mi gdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug thams cad kyang mi gdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all their poisons are neutralized.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming thos ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa'i zug rdu rnams ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming thos ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa'i zug rdu rnams ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, as soon as sentient beings hear the name of the bodhisattva who is in this heroic absorption, the afflictive pain of their attachment, aversion, and delusion will be removed.

original: lta bar gyur pa'i dug thams cad kyang mi gdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa'i dug thams cad kyang mi gdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the poisons of their views will be neutralized.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / sman gyi shing ljon pa ni rtsa ba nas byung yang sems can rnams kyi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / sman gyi shing ljon pa ni rtsa ba nas byung yang sems can rnams kyi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: even if a medicinal tree is uprooted, it will still cure the illnesses of sentient beings.

original: sdong po'am / yal ga'am /
analyzed: sdong po'am / yal ga'am /
translated: Whether it is taken from the trunk, the branches,

original: 'dab ma'am / me tog gam /
analyzed: 'dab ma'am / me tog gam /
translated: the leaves, the flowers,

original: 'bras bu'am / shun pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu'am / shun pa'am /
translated: the fruit, the bark,

original: gsog gam / snying po las blangs kyang sems can rnams kyi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gsog gam / snying po las blangs kyang sems can rnams kyi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: the pith, or the core, it will still cure the illnesses of sentient beings.

original: bsgreng ngam / 'gyel tam /
analyzed: bsgreng ngam / 'gyel tam /
translated: Whether it is taken from an upright or a fallen tree,

original: dum bu dum bur bcad pa las blangs kyang sems can rnams kyi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dum bu dum bur bcad pa las blangs kyang sems can rnams kyi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: or from a tree that has been cut into pieces, it will still cure the illnesses of sentient beings.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de ltar na sman gyi shing ljon pa ni sems can rnams kyi nad zhi bar bya ba'i 'tsho bar nam yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sman gyi shing ljon pa ni sems can rnams kyi nad zhi bar bya ba'i 'tsho bar nam yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the medicinal tree is never not a life-force for the healing of the sicknesses of sentient beings.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i 'tsho bar nam yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /🔽gang dag de la phan pa @431a *//🔽dang; gnod par byed pa de dag gi nye bar 'tsho bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i 'tsho bar nam yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin te / gang dag de la phan pa @431a *// dang; gnod par byed pa de dag gi nye bar 'tsho bar yang 'gyur /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva who is in this heroic stride samādhi is never not a life-force for the healing of the sicknesses of the afflictions of sentient beings.🔽He becomes a life-force for those who benefit and harm him.

original: gang de la bkur sti byed pa dang / bkur sti mi byed pa de dag gi nye bar 'tsho bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de la bkur sti byed pa dang / bkur sti mi byed pa de dag gi nye bar 'tsho bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a life-force for those who honor and do not honor him.

original: de shi zhing shi ba'i dus byas par gyur pa'i sha la gang dag za ba dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi ba dang / ri dvags dang / bya'i tshogs de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' de'i sngon gyi smon lam dang /
analyzed: de shi zhing shi ba'i dus byas par gyur pa'i sha la gang dag za ba dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi ba dang / ri dvags dang / bya'i tshogs de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' de'i sngon gyi smon lam dang /
translated: The animals that eat the flesh of those who have died and passed away—the two-legged and four-legged animals, the deer, and the flocks of birds—are also the result of the bodhisattva’s previous aspirations.🔽

original: tshul khrims kyi stobs bskyed pas de'i 'chi ba'i dus byas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi stobs bskyed pas de'i 'chi ba'i dus byas te /
translated: The animals that eat the flesh of that dead animal, whether they have two legs or four, or are birds or beasts, will also die because of the power of the bodhisattva’s previous aspirations and his power of discipline.

original: shi 'phos ma thag tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi 'phos ma thag tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately after they die, they will be reborn in the happy realms, in the heavens of the gods.

original: de dag ngan song dang / nad rnams dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ngan song dang / nad rnams dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be free from the lower realms and from sickness.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: de ltar na sman gyi shing ljon pa zhes bya ba de ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: de ltar na sman gyi shing ljon pa zhes bya ba de ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: that is why the medicine tree is a synonym for the bodhisattva who is practicing the heroic stride absorption.

original: blo gros brtan pa /
analyzed: blo gros brtan pa /
translated: Dṛḍhamati,

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag ma bstan par tshe rabs thams cad tu rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag ma bstan par tshe rabs thams cad tu rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the samādhi of the heroic stride will always engage in these six perfections in all his lives, even without being taught.

original: gom pa 'dor ba thams cad la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gom pa 'dor ba thams cad la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In every step he takes, he will engage in these six perfections.

original: dbugs rdub pa dang / 'byung ba thams cad la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs rdub pa dang / 'byung ba thams cad la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag 'jug par 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la'ang 'jug par bgyi'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs @457a *//
analyzed: sdig can / de bzhin gshegs @457a *//

analyzed: pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'chad na khyod mi nyan nam /

analyzed: de na sems can dpag tu med pa dag byang chub kyi phyir go cha gyon par byed de /

analyzed: de dag khyod kyi yul las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang / sems shin tu dpag tu med pa dag khyod kyi yul las 'da' bar 'gyur ro // de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi spyod pa'i yul gyis mi gos pa la bdud sdig can gyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Moreover, an immeasurable number of minds will surpass your realm.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: When this was said, Māra, the evil one, said to the bodhisattva Unstained by the Domain of Māra, “Noble son,

analyzed: bdag ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin nyan na mchi bar mi nus so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bdag ni zhags pa'i 'ching ba lngas bcings te /

analyzed: smras pa / sdig can khyod sus bcings /

translated: He said, “I thought, ‘I will go to create obstacles for this meditative absorption and I will separate those sentient beings who aspire to it from it,’ and at that time I was bound by fivefold fetters.”

analyzed: gang gi tshe na bdag de bzhin gshegs pa ni mnyes par dka' ba /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'ang mnyes par dka' ba lags kyi /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyis spyod pa'i yul gyis ma gos pas smras pa /

original: 'du shes 'dzin pas bcings so //
analyzed: 'du shes 'dzin pas bcings so //

analyzed: g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / spros pas bcings so //

translated: They are bound by the conceptualization of what is seen, heard, distinguished, and known.

original: sdig can; 'di la chos gang yang bcings pa'ang med /
analyzed: sdig can; 'di la chos gang yang bcings pa'ang med /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sdig can / chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol bas chos thams cad grol ba ste /

analyzed: ma grol ba'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo yin te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgo des chos ston to //

translated: Then, from within that assembly, seven hundred goddesses scattered divine flowers, incense, powders, perfumes, garlands,

analyzed: dag gis byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi spyod pa'i yul gyis mi gos pa'i lus la gtor nas /
translated: and ointments over the body of the bodhisattva Unstained by the Domain of Māra.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

analyzed: gang gi tshe na bdud kyi bcing pa 'di las thar bar 'gyur /
translated: when will you be liberated from the bonds of Māra?”

analyzed: rigs kyi bu des de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The noble son replied, “

analyzed: lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis yin te /

analyzed: gang lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis 'khrugs par mi byed pa de bdud kyi bcing ba las thar bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lha'i bu mo de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: des smras pa / lta bar gyur pa de dag ni chos gang gi nang du'ang song ba'ang ma yin /

analyzed: ma song ba'ang ma yin te /

analyzed: de ltar gang du'ang mi 'gro /

analyzed: gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba 'di ni bdud kyi bcing ba las thar ba yin no //

original: lta bar gyur pa de dag ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa de dag ni med pa yin te /
translated: Those convictions do not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gang yod pa dang / med par rnam par mi rtog pa de ni bdud kyi bcing ba las thar ba'o //

analyzed: lta bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni yongs su grub pa ma yin te /

analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi yongs su ma grub pa de ni bdud kyi bcing ba las thar ba'o //

analyzed: nye ba'ang ma yin te /

analyzed: gang de ltar shes shing rlom sems med pa de ni bdud kyi bcing ba las thar ba'o //

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi spyod pa'i yul gyis mi gos pas bdud sdig can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Unstained by the Domain of Māra said to Māra, the evil one:

analyzed: 'di la sdig can //

analyzed: khyod kyi g-yog lha'i bu mo 'di dag ni byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs na da khyod kyis ji ltar bya /

analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa /

analyzed: lha'i bu mo de dag gis kyang sdig can la snying rje ba bskyed nas 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: bdag cag gsol ba 'debs kyi /

analyzed: sdig can // khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed cig /

original: bde ba la 'jigs par 'du shes ma skyed cig /
analyzed: bde ba la 'jigs par 'du shes ma skyed cig /

original: bde ba la sdug bsngal du 'du shes ma skyed cig /
analyzed: bde ba la sdug bsngal du 'du shes ma skyed cig /

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi spyod pa'i yul gyis mi gos pa la bdud kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva who is unstained by the domain of Māra said to Māra, “Evil One,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of a good family,
